author: harryduu_61189
content:
Hey ndr! Two options:
Op 1: Google Workspace Routing (Requires a paid Google Workspace account)
You can configure email routing in the Google Admin console to forward specific addresses to AgentMail.
Op 2: Use a subdomain (simpler)
Create a subdomain like mail.yourdomain.com and set its MX records to point only to AgentMail. No conflict with Gmail since they're separate subdomains.

author: harryduu_61189
content:
Good question! The example shows localhost for development, but for production you'll need a publicly accessible URL.
For Vercel deployment:
1. Deploy your webhook handler as a Vercel serverless function
2. Use your Vercel URL (e.g., `https://your-app.vercel.app/api/webhook`) in AgentMail webhook settings
3. Make sure to set environment variables (API keys) in Vercel dashboard

author: haakam21
content: What time delta in particular are you looking for?

author: haakam21
content: Hi Jason, the timestamp of a message is the timestamp of when it was sent from the sending email provider. If you subscribe to the `message.received` webhook you could measure the time it takes for your servers to receive the webhook from when the message was sent. Note that this time difference would include time it takes for sending mail server to deliver the message to our mail server, time it takes for our mail server to process the message, and time for the webhook to be delivered to your server.

author: mikesteroonie
content:
1. We parse MIME headers and record authentication results (SPF, DKIM, DMARC). Emails that fail these checks are dropped as of now. 
2. For messages that are actually received/sent, you can call the get raw message endpoint(https://docs.agentmail.to/api-reference/inboxes/messages/get-raw) which should return a .eml file which will have the full mime content. Are the headers something you would like to have in the webhook payload?

author: simplehacker1313
content: Yep exactly, we can manually configure white listing something as an added measure for you but if you even reply once to the given email address, it will always be delivered and not marked as spam.

author: brrrat
content: Yes please! We are looking into potentially transferring our app to use AgentMail. Basically, all the emails would be forwarded from a single Gmail address to AgentMail, and will mostly have at least 1 document (pdf/xlsx/docs) attached, and it is critical they are properly received so that we can fetch them through the API. Although, I am assuming that if all emails we receive come from a single address, they shouldn't be flagged as spam down the line..

author: simplehacker1313
content: Right now we don’t support sender-level whitelisting inside AgentMail. Attachments from legitimate senders should be delivered however. We’re tracking whitelisting as a potential feature, so let us know if that would be important for your workflows and we will add it to roadmap 🙂

author: brrrat
content: Hi all! Is it possible to whitelist senders of emails we receive on AgentMail, so that we are sure all sent attachments are properly received / not flagged as spam?

author: haakam21
content: Hi, for now we are only offering the playground for free. We provide API keys for paid plans.

author: haakam21
content: <@317880338720489472> Figured our the issue and fixed it. We listen to insert events in our database to send `message.received` webhooks. As our traffic has grown we now regularly have multiple such events happening at the same time. These events get rolled up into batches to be processed. However, when processing a batch, an exception with one event caused the remaining events in the batch to be not processed. Have now isolated exception handling for each event. Thank you for bringing this to our attention!

author: markding
content: thanks man! appreciate all the support!

author: haakam21
content: <@317880338720489472> About to take my last meeting of the day. Will dive into the issues right after. We will also ship webhook observability features asap

author: markding
content:
yea, we are having pretty bad receive rate from webhook this week. we can see that emails are received in agentmail dashboard, but they never send to our webhook (aournd 10-25% roughly). 

we are currently writing a custom polling logic (every min) to process all the new email message from all the inboxes we have to ensure all new messages are processed successfully on our backed. it'd be great if we can see some metrics on webhook stats

author: mikesteroonie
content: @everyone node sdk briefly had a stint where serialziation wasn't enabled, so params would only accept snake_case, but now serialization is back so the newest package allows idiomatic camelCase again! This is a breaking change if you upgrade so please keep in mind when upgrading to latest npm package!

author: kirkmarple
content: The 'list inboxes' issue was likely unrelated to this receipt issue.

author: kirkmarple
content:
Looks like an issue where we were sending all inboxes to our DEV and PROD webhooks, since we can't differentiate w/o whitelisting all inboxes.

The HTTP 500 was correct, since that webhook was supposed to receive all inboxes. 

But the DEV webhook had been locked to a single inbox for some reason; recreating that solved it

author: haakam21
content: Webhook was attempted to be delivered by received 500. May be related to failure to list inboxes

author: kirkmarple
content: I deleted it and recreated new webhook, and will try again.

author: kirkmarple
content: Ah this is weird, now looking at the webhook it's locked to a single inbox; I had created it to handle all inboxes.

author: kirkmarple
content: OK, I never got a webhook for this last email, but I can see it in your dashboard.

author: haakam21
content: Yep, email sending recieving was not affected. Simply the getting the inboxes was giving errors

author: kirkmarple
content: Perfect, now I see the inboxes; should I try sending a fresh email to that inbox?

author: st0llo
content:
Second these, and would like to add 1 feature request:

### **Webhook delivery logs**
I had some issues w some webhooks not being triggered from AgentMail. Would be amazing to have an event log similar to Github/Stripe, where you can see if webhooks were fired from AgentMail: https://docs.stripe.com/webhooks#view-event-deliveries / https://docs.github.com/en/webhooks/testing-and-troubleshooting-webhooks/viewing-webhook-deliveries

This is both useful for development, but just as much for production.
